poem:
Title: The Folly of Influence

In the pixel realm of empty hearts, 
Reality's jesters trade sacred arts.
Notes of truth, scant as starlight gleams,
Lost to Love Island's treacherous schemes.

Blinding the starstruck with glittering dreams,
While Essex whispers in hidden memes.
Through the looking-glass fame beguile,
Charged by Time, the watcher's wile.

Yet justice wields her scales unflinching,
upon the finfluencers' folly, unblenching.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Love Island and Towie stars charged with promoting trading scheme on Instagram The UK’s financial watchdog has charged seven reality TV stars, including former Love Island contestants and cast members from The Only Way is Essex (Towie), with promoting an unauthorised foreign exchange trading scheme on Instagram. The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has brought charges against nine people in a crackdown on “finfluencers” who have a total of 4.5m followers on the social media platform.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
